title: broken MIR: bad assignment (&impl Trait = &S): NoSolution

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
I am not sure if this is a issue in nightly build 
error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:12 ~ main[317d]::main[0]) (_6 = &(*_7)): bad assignment (&impl Trait = &S): NoSolution
  --> main.rs:28:26
   |
28 |   let b : & impl Trait = &S;
   |                          ^^
   |
   = note: delayed at src\librustc_mir\borrow_check\type_check\mod.rs:258:27

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.47.0-beta.1 (0f91f5c28 2020-08-25) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
